definitions.definition: A lifesaver : a rescuer , usually an expert swimmer, employed to save swimmers in trouble or near drowning at a body of water.
A bodyguard or unit of bodyguards, a guard of someone's (especially a king's) life or person.
A sturdy metal bracket fixed in front of each of the leading wheels of a train to deflect small objects away from the wheels to prevent derailment .

main_definition: A lifesaver : a rescuer , usually an expert swimmer, employed to save swimmers in trouble or near drowning at a body of water.
secondary_definitions: ( uncommon ) A bodyguard or unit of bodyguards, a guard of someone's (especially a king's) life or person.
( rail transport ) A sturdy metal bracket fixed in front of each of the leading wheels of a train to deflect small objects away from the wheels to prevent derailment .
